org.apache.juneau.rest.client

Class RestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    @ConfigurableContext(nocache=true)
public class RestClient
extends BeanContext
implements Closeable
    Utility class for interfacing with remote REST interfaces.
    Features
    • Convert POJOs directly to HTTP request message bodies using Serializer class.
    • Convert HTTP response message bodies directly to POJOs using Parser class.
    • Fluent interface.
    • Thread safe.
    • API for interacting with remote services.
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RESTCLIENT_executorService

        public static final String RESTCLIENT_executorService
        Configuration property: Executor service.
        Property:
        • Name: "RestClient.executorService.o"
        • Data type: Class<? implements ExecutorService> or ExecutorService.
        • Default: null.
        • Methods:
          • RestClientBuilder.executorService(ExecutorService, boolean)
        Description:

        Defines the executor service to use when calling future methods on the RestCall class.

        This executor service is used to create Future objects on the following methods:

        • RestCall.runFuture()
        • RestCall.getResponseFuture(Class)
        • RestCall.getResponseFuture(Type,Type...)
        • RestCall.getResponseAsString()

        The default executor service is a single-threaded ThreadPoolExecutor with a 30 second timeout and a queue size of 10.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RESTCLIENT_executorServiceShutdownOnClose

        public static final String RESTCLIENT_executorServiceShutdownOnClose

        • Default: false
        • Methods:

        Description:

        Call ExecutorService.shutdown() when close() is called.

      • RESTCLIENT_rootUri

        public static final String RESTCLIENT_rootUri
        Configuration property: Root URI.
        Property:
        • Name: "RestClient.rootUri.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: false
        • Methods:
          • RestClientBuilder.rootUrl(Object)
        Description:

        When set, relative URL strings passed in through the various rest call methods (e.g. doGet(Object) will be prefixed with the specified root.
        This root URL is ignored on those methods if you pass in a URL, URI, or an absolute URL string.
        Trailing slashes are trimmed.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static RestClientBuilder create(Serializer s,
                                       Parser p)

        Shortcut for calling RestClient.create().serializer(s).parser(p);

        Parameters:
        s - The serializer to use for output.
        p - The parser to use for input.
        Returns:
        A new RestClientBuilder object.

      • hasContent

        protected boolean hasContent(String httpMethod)
        Returns true if specified http method has content.

        By default, anything not in this list can have content: GET, HEAD, DELETE, CONNECT, OPTIONS, TRACE.

        Parameters:
        httpMethod - The HTTP method. Must be upper-case.
        Returns:
        true if specified http method has content.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Calls Closeable.close() on the underlying CloseableHttpClient.

        It's good practice to call this method after the client is no longer used.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown by underlying stream.

      • doGet

        public RestCall doGet(Object url)
               throws RestCallException
        Perform a GET request against the specified URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If any authentication errors occurred.

      • doPut

        public RestCall doPut(Object url,
                      Object o)
               throws RestCallException
        Perform a PUT request against the specified URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        o - The object to serialize and transmit to the URL as the body of the request. Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If any authentication errors occurred.

      • doPut

        public RestCall doPut(Object url)
               throws RestCallException
        Same as doPut(Object, Object) but don't specify the input yet.

        You must call either RestCall.body(Object) or RestCall.formData(String, Object) to set the contents on the result object.

        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - REST call failed.

      • doPost

        public RestCall doPost(Object url,
                       Object o)
                throws RestCallException
        Perform a POST request against the specified URL.
        • Use doFormPost(Object, Object) for application/x-www-form-urlencoded form posts.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        o - The object to serialize and transmit to the URL as the body of the request. Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If any authentication errors occurred.

        You must call either RestCall.body(Object) or RestCall.formData(String, Object) to set the contents on the result object.

        • Use doFormPost(Object, Object) for application/x-www-form-urlencoded form posts.

      • doFormPost

        public RestCall doFormPost(Object url,
                           Object o)
                    throws RestCallException
        Perform a POST request with a content type of application/x-www-form-urlencoded against the specified URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        o - The object to serialize and transmit to the URL as the body of the request, serialized as a form post using the UrlEncodingSerializer.DEFAULT serializer.

        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:

        Throws:
        RestCallException - REST call failed.

      • doCallback

        public RestCall doCallback(String callString)
                    throws RestCallException
        Performs a REST call where the entire call is specified in a simple string.

        This method is useful for performing callbacks when the target of a callback is passed in on an initial request, for example to signal when a long-running process has completed.

        The call string can be any of the following formats:

        • "[method] [url]" - e.g. "GET http://localhost/callback"
        • "[method] [url] [payload]" - e.g. "POST http://localhost/callback some text payload"
        • "[method] [headers] [url] [payload]" - e.g. "POST {'Content-Type':'text/json'} http://localhost/callback {'some':'json'}"

        The payload will always be sent using a simple StringEntity.

        Parameters:
        callString - The call string.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - REST call failed.

      • doCall

        public RestCall doCall(HttpMethod method,
                       Object url,
                       Object content)
                throws RestCallException
        Perform a generic REST call.
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method.
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        content - The HTTP body content. Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        • NameValuePairs - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
        This parameter is IGNORED if HttpMethod.hasContent() is false.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If any authentication errors occurred.

      • doCall

        public RestCall doCall(String method,
                       Object url,
                       boolean hasContent)
                throws RestCallException
        Perform a generic REST call.
        Parameters:
        method - The method name (e.g. "GET", "OPTIONS").
        url - The URL of the remote REST resource. Can be any of the following: String, URI, URL.
        hasContent - Boolean flag indicating if the specified request has content associated with it.
        Returns:
        A RestCall object that can be further tailored before executing the request and getting the response as a parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If any authentication errors occurred.

      • getRemote

        public <T> T getRemote(Class<T> interfaceClass)
        Create a new proxy interface against a 3rd-party REST interface.

        The URL to the REST interface is based on the following values:

        • The @Remote(path) annotation on the interface (remote-path).
        • The rootUrl on the client (root-url).
        • The fully-qualified class name of the interface (class-name).

        The URL calculation is as follows:

        • remote-path - If remote path is absolute.
        • root-url/remote-path - If remote path is relative and root-url has been specified.
        • root-url/class-name - If remote path is not specified.

        If the information is not available to resolve to an absolute URL, a RemoteMetadataException is thrown.

        Examples:

        package org.apache.foo; @RemoteResource(path="http://hostname/resturl/myinterface1") public interface MyInterface1 { ... } @RemoteResource(path="/myinterface2") public interface MyInterface2 { ... } public interface MyInterface3 { ... } // Resolves to "http://localhost/resturl/myinterface1" MyInterface1 i1 = RestClient .create() .build() .getRemoteResource(MyInterface1.class); // Resolves to "http://hostname/resturl/myinterface2" MyInterface2 i2 = RestClient .create() .rootUrl("http://hostname/resturl") .build() .getRemoteResource(MyInterface2.class); // Resolves to "http://hostname/resturl/org.apache.foo.MyInterface3" MyInterface3 i3 = RestClient .create() .rootUrl("http://hostname/resturl") .build() .getRemoteResource(MyInterface3.class);

        • If you plan on using your proxy in a multi-threaded environment, you'll want to use an underlying pooling client connection manager.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - The interface to create a proxy for.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.
        Throws:
        RemoteMetadataException - If the REST URI cannot be determined based on the information given.

      • getRemote

        public <T> T getRemote(Class<T> interfaceClass,
                       Object restUrl)
        Same as getRemote(Class) except explicitly specifies the URL of the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - The interface to create a proxy for.
        restUrl - The URL of the REST interface.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.

      • getRemote

        public <T> T getRemote(Class<T> interfaceClass,
                       Object restUrl,
                       Serializer serializer,
                       Parser parser)
        Same as getRemote(Class, Object) but allows you to override the serializer and parser used.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - The interface to create a proxy for.
        restUrl - The URL of the REST interface.
        serializer - The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
        parser - The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.

      • getRrpcInterface

        public <T> T getRrpcInterface(Class<T> interfaceClass)
        Create a new Remote Interface against a @RemoteInterface-annotated class.

        Remote interfaces are interfaces exposed on the server side using either the RrpcServlet or RRPC REST methods.

        The URL to the REST interface is based on the following values:

        • The @Remote(path) annotation on the interface (remote-path).
        • The rootUrl on the client (root-url).
        • The fully-qualified class name of the interface (class-name).

        The URL calculation is as follows:

        • remote-path - If remote path is absolute.
        • root-url/remote-path - If remote path is relative and root-url has been specified.
        • root-url/class-name - If remote path is not specified.

        If the information is not available to resolve to an absolute URL, a RemoteMetadataException is thrown.

        • If you plan on using your proxy in a multi-threaded environment, you'll want to use an underlying pooling client connection manager.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - The interface to create a proxy for.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.
        Throws:
        RemoteMetadataException - If the REST URI cannot be determined based on the information given.

      • getRrpcInterface

        public <T> T getRrpcInterface(Class<T> interfaceClass,
                              Object restUrl)
        Same as getRrpcInterface(Class) except explicitly specifies the URL of the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - The interface to create a proxy for.
        restUrl - The URL of the REST interface.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.

      • getRrpcInterface

        public <T> T getRrpcInterface(Class<T> interfaceClass,
                              Object restUrl,

                              Parser parser)
        Same as getRrpcInterface(Class, Object) but allows you to override the serializer and parser used.

        serializer - The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
        parser - The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
        Returns:
        The new proxy interface.
